snippet: A militia temporarily shut down Tripoli's airport in the latest instance of the interim government's inability to rein in armed groups that emerged in the uprising that ultimately toppled Libya's dictator, Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.
abstract: A militia temporarily shut down Tripoli's airport in the latest instance of the interim government's inability to rein in armed groups that emerged in the uprising that ultimately toppled Libya's dictator, Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.

headline.main: Armed Group Briefly Seizes Tripoli Airport
